programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When the team works with a group of astronomy experts to conduct a telescope and rocket experiment at the Triangle Area on Skinwalker Ranch, they have their most incredible UAP encounter yet.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: While uncovering evidence of a massive underground cave system said to exist beneath the ranch's mysterious mesa, the Skinwalker team also broadcasts a strange signal recorded on the property over the airwaves of a local radio station.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: After recovering metal fragments from a massive, dome-shaped object buried in the mesa on Skinwalker Ranch, the team conducts a scientific test that reveals shocking results.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When the team conducts its most ambitious experiment yet at the Triangle, it is shocked by what appears in the sky above Skinwalker Ranch.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: With winter approaching and time running out, the team performs a three-dimensional scan of Skinwalker Ranch and makes an incredible discovery that may help explain some of the bizarre phenomena they have encountered on the property.

programme.title: This Week With George Stephanopoulos
programme.desc: Former Clinton White House staffer and current co-anchor of ABC's weekday morning news show "Good Morning America," George Stephanopoulos and co-anchors Martha Raddatz and Jonathan Karl offer a look at current events with a focus on the politics of the day. Each week's show includes interviews with top newsmakers (including some of the nation's top political leaders) as well as a roundtable discussion, usually featuring journalists from ABC and other news organizations, of the week's happenings. Since 2008, the program has broadcast from a studio at the Newseum in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Big Papi was at his best when it mattered, heralded as the greatest playoff clutch hitter of all-time. Filmed over the course of just six weeks, David Ortiz: Legend Of The Fall documents the three time world champion's recent induction in the baseball Hall of Fame – capturing the lead-up to this momentous event, the actual ceremony and the afterglow of his enshrinement.

programme.title: Episode 3
programme.desc: An amateur takes on the biggest names in poker in a high stakes cash game in Las Vegas. This week, a new rivalry emerges, as Lex Veldhuis and Alan Keating compete for a pot worth more than a quarter of a million dollars.

programme.title: Episode 4
programme.desc: The high stakes cash game continues in Las Vegas, with more than a million dollars now on the table. Entrepreneur Alan Keating continues to drive the action, determined to play every single hand, and make big moves.

programme.title: Episode 5
programme.desc: It's the final session of this high stakes game in Vegas, and the last chance for the amateur ‘Loose Cannon’ to make a profit. Meanwhile, Hollywood actors Arden Cho and Jennifer Tilly play a hand worth $400,000.

programme.title: Episode 6
programme.desc: A fresh cast of characters take their seats in Las Vegas for a high stakes cash game, including poker pros Phil Laak and Maria Ho, actor-writer-comedian Michael Ian Black, and an amateur player – a new ‘Loose Cannon’ – looking to make more than just memories.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The dream of long travel suspension on Roadkill's slightly modified Vette Kart finally comes true for the guys; Brad DeBerti helps them figure out how to not taco the front end as they take on a Pro2 truck on an off-road short course.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern give new life to a '57 Chevy Bel Air that was pulled from a junkyard after more than 30 years. The guys drop in a small-block V8 and turbo 350 to get the car back on the pavement for a bumpy road trip back to where it came from.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Dulcich enlists Wiley Stevens and Chris Birdsong to transplant a third-generation Hemi into the 1974 Dodge D100, also known as the Mopar Muscle Truck; after issues hold up progress, the guys clean up a new project 1974 Dodge Charger.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys put John Andrade Jr. in a tiny truck and beat him in a mud drag race with the Dirt Track Camaro; Andrade challenges them to see what they can do with a derelict and parted-out Mustang against his 79 Chevy Malibu.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys attempt to check off the final five states Freiburger needs to hit all 50 by taking their junkyard T-37 across New England; the T-37 hits the road, and the road hits back before the guys leave their mark in New York City.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich troubleshoot transmission issues and more in the 1969 Chevy Impala that's powered by a supercharged 498ci big-block V8, then take it back to the track to see if they can finally get their 10-second time slip.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys transform a '73 Opel funny car into a dirt-roosting machine.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike generate epic amounts of tire smoke as they try out 2015 supercars, the 707-horsepower Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat and Charger SRT Hellcat, plus a 645-horsepower Dodge Viper GT.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's a project-car mishmash this time on Roadkill, powered by Dodge. It starts out Roadkill enough, with Finnegan surprising Freiburger with a '50 Ford 2-ton truck that the guys thrash to shorten up into a bobber rat rod.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Things do not go as planned when Finnegan and Freiburger swap the engines from an old Rogers Bonneville jet boat and a lowered '74 Chevy C10 pickup powered by a Chevrolet Performance LS6 crate engine.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A 1980 Chevrolet Monte Carlo lowrider with hydraulics and Super Swamper off-road tires becomes the perfect vehicle for a desert trip to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage

programme.title: Doubles Poker Championship
programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. They are then randomly paired off and compete as two-person teams that share the play on each hand. With $1 million in first place prize money at stake, which team will survive the gauntlet of clashing personalities and top shelf competition in a game that's usually a single-minded endeavor?

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Pot-Limit Omaha returns, as does Lou Garza with the chip lead. Garza looks for retribution in Event #9 ahead of Sean Winter, Miles Rampel, Jeremy Ausmus, and Ben Lamb as $365,500 awaits the winner.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Mikita Badziakouski holds the chip lead ahead of Ali Imsirovic, Daniel Negreanu, Jason Koon, and Seth Davies in Event 10. There is $342,000 awaiting the eventual winner, while Negreanu is eyeing the Poker Masters Purple Jacket.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: A massive $680,000 first-place prize awaits the winner in Event #11 as Australian Michael Addamo holds the chip lead. Trailing Addamo are Jason Koon, David Coleman, Cary Katz, and Alex Foxen who are all looking to grab their first Poker Masters title of the year.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The champion returns as the chip leader as Michael Addamo is eyeing back-to-back victories and the Poker Masters Purple Jacket. The final five players also include Nick Petrangelo, Stanley Tang, Alex Foxen, and Mikita Badziakouski as $1,160,000 awaits the Event #12 winner.

programme.title: Poker Masters

programme.title: World Series of Poker

programme.desc: Belle Starr (Jane Russell), a voluptuous outlaw, is lying low in a small desert town with Bob Dalton (Scott Brady) and his feckless bank robber brothers. When wealthy saloon keeper Tom Bradfield (George Brent) takes a liking to her, Belle reassesses her options and considers playing the men against each another. Knowing that Tom wants to get Bob out of the picture, she leads one suitor on a crime spree against the other while puzzling through her complicated romances.

programme.title: Yellowstone Kelly
programme.desc: Union soldier Maj. Towns (Rhodes Reason) asks fur trapper and Indian scout Luther "Yellowstone" Kelly (Clint Walker) to scout for the Army in Sioux territory. Kelly ventures into the area, only to be taken prisoner by the Sioux. Since Kelly saved the life of Chief Gall (John Russell) years before, the chief promises to free him if Kelly treats wounded Arapaho maiden Wahleeah (Andra Martin). Soon Kelly and the recovered Wahleeah are caught between Towns' soldiers and the vengeful Sioux.

programme.title: Gold of the Seven Saints
programme.desc: After discovering a fortune in gold nuggets, Shaun Garrett (Roger Moore) and his partner, Jim Rainbolt (Clint Walker), make their way toward the town of Seven Saints to redeem it for cash. Word of their find reaches bandit McCracken (Gene Evans), who comes after them. The men hide their treasure and fend off McCracken with the help of Doc Gates (Chill Wills), before escaping to recover at the ranch of Rainbolt's friend, Amos Gondora (Robert Middleton), waiting until they can retrieve the gold.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the 'Legends Special' with all of the worst but funniest competitors from the last three series.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, twenty intrepid contestants take on four gruelling obstacles.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The episode that has gone down in TV history. Tim Gray was the 21 year-old Head Chef at Bonaparte's in Silsden, West Yorkshire. Claiming to specialise in "fine dining", he had ambitions to be a TV chef and dreamed of opening restaurants in London, Paris and New York. Unfortunately, Tim couldn't even cook an omelette and his trademark scallops made Ramsay throw up. A true kitchen nightmare if ever there was one.
With no customers and a fridge full of fancy ingredients, Bonaparte's was losing money fast. Ramsay soon established that what the people of Silsden really want to eat is Beef and Ale Pie and Treacle Tart. Ramsay soon had the restaurant chocker block but what state is it in now?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Saturday night at The Glass House Restaurant in Ambleside was a disaster. Orders in the kitchen were mixed up, the food wasn't cooked properly and the customers were complaining. Not only was the chef in tears, but the owners were on the brink of bankruptcy.
A few months on, there have been some departures from the Glass House. Who is in charge of the kitchen now? And, more importantly, is Ramsay's Caesar salad still on the menu?

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S04:E07 - Episode 7

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S04:E08 - Episode 8

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The Walnut Tree Inn was in big trouble - there was no head chef, the customers had dwindled, and the owner had been forced to sell the family home to keep the business afloat. Set in beautiful Welsh countryside, The Walnut Tree Inn was a successful business for 37 years and became a national institution. But when Francesco bought the place 3 years ago he made the mistake of turning the warm and welcoming country inn into a cold and stark London-style restaurant. And when things went wrong he tried to run the kitchen as well as the front of house. With its Michelin star in jeopardy, Ramsay's first job was to recruit a new head chef so the owner could concentrate on customers. But has Francesco managed to follow Ramsay's advice and stop meddling in the kitchen?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Nick and Richard are self-confessed restaurant virgins. They've both had successful careers in the brewery business so when they bought Moore Place they believed they could make it an instant success. What they hadn't realized was just how difficult it would be to fill the 90-seater oak-paneled restaurant and how hard it would be to find a chef who could cook decent food.
Has Ramsay's fast-track guide to restaurant success helped these brewery whiz-kids transform their failing ex-Berni Inn into a profitable business? And is the building still painted that disgusting shade of purple?

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will face an egg-cellent challenge and compete in pairs to see who can complete the most deviled eggs in 12 minutes. The team that perfects the most deviled eggs will be safe from the next elimination challenge, in which contestants must create their future cookbook’s signature dish. In the second hour, Christina Tosi brings a special guest into the MASTERCHEF kitchen, her mom, to present the next mystery box challenge, which will feature all of Christina’s favorite childhood foods. Then, contestants will compete in a tag team platter challenge using international street food ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The banquet is finally here. It's the culmination of months of hard work as the winning chefs strive to plate up perfect dishes for the ladies of the Women's Institute, at London's historic Draper's Hall where pioneers of the WI once gathered.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. A dish celebrating childhood summer memories takes on a complicated courgette dish and a technically tricky take on the cucumber sandwich.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more intense as all the chefs take risks with their dishes. Mike Reid, executive chef at M Restaurants in London, shocks when he pairs his fish with some highly unusual flavours.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a smoke filled kitchen as the three chefs prepare their summer-themed mains in the hope of impressing the veteran judge. Selin Kiazim is in her element, cooking a feast inspired by the summer barbecues she enjoyed with her family.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are feeling the pressure as they attempt their technical summer desserts. With only the two highest scorers going through to the regional final, who will be sent home?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the South East chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs have been challenged to create outstanding dishes that capture a `taste of summer'. Their menus must reflect the tastes, smells and colours of everybody's favourite time of year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and, with a seafood specialist in the kitchen, the competition is stepping up a gear. Tom is hoping he'll be able to elevate the humble mackerel to the standards required for the Wimbledon banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are honouring Wimbledon and the British summer with their technically challenging strawberry desserts. Only the two highest scorers will go through to cook for the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs compete for a place in the national finals. To get there they'll have to impress the formidable panel of judges: Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tom Parker is eager to impress with a salad that includes 10 elements. Meanwhile, Paul Askew, hopes his traditional techniques will triumph over his younger competitors, and Ellis Barrie is taking a risk with a creative cucumber and oyster starter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen gets even tenser as the three newcomers begin to understand the perfection and skill the veteran chef demands. Ellis Barrie attempts to create the flavour of a summer barbecue.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and the pressure is intense in the kitchen. In the hope of impressing the veteran judge, Paul Askew is serving an extremely personal main course based on his mother's favourite food.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Paul can't afford to make any mistakes and is pushing himself with a technically challenging baked alaska.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining north west chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. The guest judge is Greg Rusedski, former British number one, who understands the high standards expected at Wimbledon.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning banquet champion Tommy Banks takes on two ambitious newcomers, Danny Parker and Josh Overington. They start by finding out whois the surprise veteran judge and who will be marking their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated, the three chefs are cooking their fish courses. Josh Overington creates a decadent dish inspired by the prestige of the Wimbledon Championships.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are cooking their main courses and are all taking risks to try and win a place at the banquet. Danny Parker is trying to recreate the flavours of an American barbecue but the veteran chef is dubious about one of his ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. All the chefs are using unusual ingredients in their desserts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs from the north east must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver, and guest Judy Murray.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Scottish regional heats and returning chefs to the competition Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath battle ambitious newcomer Angela Malik for a place in the national finals. This time they are cooking their starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated and the veteran chef is expecting perfection from the fish course. Ally McGrath creates an inventive dish based on his summer memories of rock pooling in the River Tweed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Angela Malik is in her element cooking a tiffin box based on memories of summer picnics. Michael Bremner is taking a huge risk, and Ally is creating an inventive dish based on a summer barbeque.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Angela Malik is cooking a technically challenging dessert.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two Scottish chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver. They are joined by guest judge Gary Parsons.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Determined newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie take on returning chef Phil Carmichael for a place in the national finals. It's Phil's third time in the competition and this year he's determined to make it to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses. Paul Croasdale is trying to recreate the elegance of Wimbledon with luxury ingredients such as king crab and scallops.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the main course, all three chefs are cooking Welsh lamb in the hope of impressing the judge. Phil is taking a risk with barbecued lamb and in an attempt to elevate a humble barbecue to banquet level, he's serving it with many accompaniments.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges so all three chefs are feeling the pressure. Phil Carmichael creates a tennis ball dessert that combines two British classics, Eton mess and trifle.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two winning chefs from the Wales region must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges and guest judge Dan Bloxham, Wimbledon's Master of Ceremonies.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Pip Lacey's starter is a humorous take on the unpredictable British weather and features an unusual presentation. Ryan Simpson's dish represents an allotment complete with soil, while Nick Deverell-Smith's creation is a tribute to the precision cutting of Wimbledon's grass.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With the chefs hoping to impress, they each take risks. Pip Lacey combines lobster with strawberry in a tribute to strawberries and cream. Ryan Simpson's also using lobster in his recreation of a BBQ and has invented a technique to create his chips.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ryan Simpson hopes to elevate a ploughman's lunch into a gourmet affair, Pip Lacey pays tribute to an unusual Wimbledon icon, while Nick Deverell-Smith looks to celebrate a meat which he thinks is underused, venison.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges. Pip Lacey's pineapple dessert uses coriander. Nick Deverell-Smith also pays tribute to the pineapple, creating a dessert featuring a rice pudding made with couscous.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who've made it through cook their four courses again. They must impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest judge Jordanne Whiley, one of Britain's most successful wheelchair tennis players.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. Eddie is hoping to do better than last year, Joery is hoping to impress with a tribute to Richard Krajicek, and Tommy is creating a warm salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Joery Castel is combining mackerel and cucumber, and Tommy Heaney hopes his Murray Mound is a fitting tribute to Andy Murray's love of sushi. Eddie Attwell is creating five different strawberry elements to accompany the scallops in his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who have made it through cook their four courses again. They are hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver, who are joined by tennis's greatest entertainer, Mansour Bahrami.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With finals week ahead of them, judge Andi Oliver first summons the chefs to Wimbledon to take a look at where they could be cooking if they win. The judges are joined by guest judge Sue Barker, host of the Wimbledon coverage for more than 20 years.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but with some exceptionally high scoring dishes in the regional heats, each chef will need to deliver perfection in order to see off the competition. The judges are joined by guest judge Tim Henman.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. As the barbecues are fired up, all eight chefs are feeling the heat. The judges are joined by guest judge Gordon Reid.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is dessert day and with just one place remaining at the Wimbledon banquet, each chef is giving everything they have got. The judges are joined by guest judge Annabel Croft, former British number one and Junior Wimbledon champion.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale and the winning chefs must now cook their dishes at the banquet. Once in the kitchen, the chefs face the huge challenge of scaling up their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Competing for top spot are Danny Parker, head chef at Michelin starred `House of Tides' in Newcastle, who is back to try his luck in the competition again after being knocked out in the regional heat last year following a tense tie-break. He's taking on two newcomers: Dan Fletcher, protégé of Phil Howard, and now head chef at `Fenchurch' in the City of London, and David Coulson,who runs `Peace and Loaf' in Newcastle, which boasts 2 AA rosettes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course the chefs are all aiming for 10s with their unique fish dishes. David is celebrating a personal connection to the brief with his `My Cod I Bet Me Ma'am Has Seen Some Trotters', a tribute to his mum who has worked as a chiropodist. Dan's `For All Those Sleepless Nights' pays tribute to nightshift workers from the NHS with some bold but classic flavours while Danny's `Not All Superheroes Wear Capes' aims to give a taste of luxury to the hardworking staff.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dan pays tribute to an icon of modern nursing, Florence Nightingale, while Danny is inspired by the founder of the NHS, Aneurin Bevan. David's dish is dedicated to the air ambulance staff who saved the life of his fiancé, and he even takes a trip to meet one of them.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the chefs' last chance to impress and tensions are high. Dan takes a risk with an unusual combination of ewe's milk and bergamot while Danny is determined to pull out all the stops with his complex dessert `Aunty Gwen's Chocolate'. David hopes to transform a childhood comfort classic into a show stopping dessert. Dan also takes a trip to meet Dr Ben Clarke who was working in the Royal London Hospital A&E during the London Bridge terror attack.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they serve their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Banquet champion Selin Kiazim, a rising star of the London scene renowned for her Turkish Cypriot fusion flavours, is back hoping to join the elite group of chefs who have made it to the banquet twice. She is up against James Cochran who's worked at some of London's toughest kitchens including 2 Michelin starred `The Ledbury' and Scott Goss from `The Twenty Six' in Tunbridge Wells, renowned for his use of local Kent ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs do battle for the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen is tense. Lobster is catch of the day for James whose dish is Caribbean-inspired. Scott is attempting to elevate a classic fish pie, dedicated to his mum who worked as a pharmacist in the NHS for 23 years. And Selin is taking a risk with a complex three-part fish dish featuring sardines, scallops and langoustines, as a nod to the purported health benefits of a Mediterranean diet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scott is showcasing rare-breed Tamworth pork to say thank you to the rare breed of people who work for the NHS. Selin is serving a complex duck dish using ingredients from all around the world to honour `Our Global NHS'. And James is presenting five cuts of goat cooked in five different ways, for his bold dish `Under The Knife'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Selin puts her own unique twist on tea and toast. James creates a decadent coconut parfait accompanied by mango puree filled doughnuts for his dessert `Tree of Life' inspired by the coconut palm tree, the NHS and both of their contributions to our health. Scott hopes his elevated gypsy tart `Honey Bee Good' will secure him a place in the final.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the south east chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they remake their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: Autistic gardener Alan Gardner returns, launching himself into suburbia with some ingenious designs. This time he has £10,000 to transform a desolate Lancashire plot.

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: Autistic gardener Alan Gardner travels to Bristol, where Ig, Joe and their three kids need help with their 100 foot garden, that's currently overflowing with weeds and waste.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty assesses the progress, successes and failures of his paradise garden. Elsewhere, Frances Tophill travels to Glasgow to meet a gardener whose hands-off approach to his garden has reaped rewards for wildlife.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: A single mum of two in Redditch, Holly's garden has turned into a virtual jungle. Can the intrepid threesome come up with a plan to give this family a safe and fun place to play?

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge that has become a focal point for the local community.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.desc: Capture a vision of glory with Bob Ross as you view the brilliance of afternoon sunlight peeking over a distant mountain top.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting with Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting with Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting with Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting with Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting with Bob Ross

programme.desc: Guest painter Steve Ross uses lots of color in this stirring depiction of giant peaks behind foothills opening onto a smooth lake.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting with Bob Ross

programme.desc: Bob Ross begins with a black canvas to create this startling rendition of a snowy landscape with the notorious lights of the northern sky.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting with Bob Ross

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Everglades City Florida to meet up with local Capt. Jimmy Wheeler of the Everglades Fishing Company to get a taste of what the saying "Old Florida" really means. With the SeaVee 270Z bay boat in tow, the guys look to Jimmy to put them on the bite, fishing the shallow inshore wrecks and rock piles for Snook, Grouper, and Cobia.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In this episode, we visit the coast of North Carolina where host Ryan McVinney meets up with filmmaker Jonas Pate and his family to discuss the real life inspiration behind his hit Netflix show Outer Banks. We learn about Carolina Skiffs and visit Grady-White in Greenville, then meet some professional boat cinematographers and local custom Carolina sport fishing yacht dealers. Finally we stop in Washington to reminisce about the early days of powerboat racing with champion Reggie Fountain, who regales viewers with tales of beating Don Johnson, Kurt Russell, Al Copeland and Chuck Norris while setting speed records and capturing the title of the fastest V-bottom boat in the world. From go-fast speed boats to family cruising we see some of what makes North Carolina’s storied boating culture unique and special.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the world’s best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Florida’s coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the area’s most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: In this episode of Tidewater Diaries, Captain C.A. embarks on a captivating journey with offshore fishing YouTube sensation Captain Nick Stanczyk of StanzFam, renowned as the "Swordfish King." Together, they unravel the secrets behind Captain Nick's legendary status, sharing thrilling tales of swordfish expeditions on the open seas. The episode not only explores the intricacies of swordfishing techniques but also delves into the rich history of Bud & Mary's Marina. Through a nostalgic lens, Captain C.A. and Captain Nick vividly depict the marina's origins, capturing the essence of its enduring significance in maritime culture.

programme.title: Local Knowledge

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Everglades City Florida to meet up with local Capt. Jimmy Wheeler of the Everglades Fishing Company to get a taste of what the saying "Old Florida" really means. With the SeaVee 270Z bay boat in tow, the guys look to Jimmy to put them on the bite, fishing the shallow inshore wrecks and rock piles for Snook, Grouper, and Cobia.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In this episode, we visit the coast of North Carolina where host Ryan McVinney meets up with filmmaker Jonas Pate and his family to discuss the real life inspiration behind his hit Netflix show Outer Banks. We learn about Carolina Skiffs and visit Grady-White in Greenville, then meet some professional boat cinematographers and local custom Carolina sport fishing yacht dealers. Finally we stop in Washington to reminisce about the early days of powerboat racing with champion Reggie Fountain, who regales viewers with tales of beating Don Johnson, Kurt Russell, Al Copeland and Chuck Norris while setting speed records and capturing the title of the fastest V-bottom boat in the world. From go-fast speed boats to family cruising we see some of what makes North Carolina’s storied boating culture unique and special.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the world’s best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Florida’s coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the area’s most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: In this episode of Tidewater Diaries, Captain C.A. embarks on a captivating journey with offshore fishing YouTube sensation Captain Nick Stanczyk of StanzFam, renowned as the "Swordfish King." Together, they unravel the secrets behind Captain Nick's legendary status, sharing thrilling tales of swordfish expeditions on the open seas. The episode not only explores the intricacies of swordfishing techniques but also delves into the rich history of Bud & Mary's Marina. Through a nostalgic lens, Captain C.A. and Captain Nick vividly depict the marina's origins, capturing the essence of its enduring significance in maritime culture.

programme.title: Berlin, I Love You

programme.title: Hot to Trot

programme.title: Osmosis Jones

programme.title: Strange Brew

programme.title: True Stories

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Six young urbanites with budding careers and restless hearts share their dreams, their music, and the common courtyard between their apartments.

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Neurotic conman Roy and his protégé Frank find their latest scam disrupted when Roy discovers he has a teen daughter who wants to meet him.

programme.title: Charlotte Gray
programme.desc: During World War II, a young Scottish woman travels to London, then gets involved with the French Resistance while trying to rescue her missing lover.

programme.title: Chaos Theory
programme.desc: An obsessively organized man learns that he’s sterile … and that his daughter was fathered by his best friend.

programme.title: Beyond The Poseidon Adventure
programme.desc: Two rival salvage teams race through a capsized luxury liner to claim a secret fortune aboard the ship.

programme.title: Corrina, Corrina
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg and Ray Liotta star in the story of a maid in 1959 whose care for a widower and his daughter leads to racial backlash of their love.

programme.title: Critters
programme.desc: After escaping from a maximum-security prison asteroid, a band of extraterrestrial flesh-eating criminals unwittingly land on planet Earth.

programme.title: Critters 2: The Main Course
programme.desc: When two men find a bunch of exotic eggs, the critters soon hatch and unleash a hungry horde of ugly little monsters on their small Kansas town.

programme.title: Critters 3
programme.desc: Let round three begin in the battle for the planet! The flesh-eating alien fuzzballs return to try a whole new fare: city dwellers.

programme.title: Critters 4
programme.desc: This futuristic tale finds spacecraft crew members dealing with an infestation of furry, flesh-eating creatures let loose aboard their ship.

programme.title: Dungeons & Dragons

programme.title: Curly Sue
programme.desc: Conning people on the streets to survive, an orphan and her down-and-out guardian try to pull a scam on a jaded attorney ready to open her heart.

programme.title: The Principal
programme.desc: After taking a bat to the Porsche of his ex-wife’s divorce attorney, teacher Rick Latimer is punished with a principal post at a violent high school.

programme.title: Final Descent
programme.desc: When his aircraft collides with another plane in midair, Captain Glen "Lucky" Singer must try to save the lives of his 319 passengers.

programme.title: Final Run
programme.desc: On a family trip, Glen "Lucky" Singer must stop a train from careening toward disaster when an engineer's mistake causes a glitch in the controls.

programme.title: Blue Thunder
programme.desc: Classic ‘80s action film about a police pilot who learns that the futuristic helicopter he’s testing could cause hellish destruction on U.S. citizens.

programme.title: Ike : Countdown to D-Day
programme.desc: This film is the story of two great military men, their relationship, and the plotting of the global offensive, which turned the tide of World War II.

programme.title: Baby Blue Marine
programme.desc: A would-be Marine masquerades as a hero by assuming the identity of a real soldier, but, through acts of bravery, becomes a true hero in the end.

programme.title: In the Line of Fire
programme.desc: The story of a man looking to redeem himself by saving the life of America's highest elected official, even if it means sacrificing himself.

programme.title: Thunderheart
programme.desc: A part-Native American FBI agent's life is in danger when he discovers a conspiracy to frame an activist for a murder on indigenous land.

programme.title: Suspect
programme.desc: Kathleen is an overworked public defender who needs a vacation. Instead, she is given another case with no ordinary crime and no ordinary criminal.

programme.title: No Mercy
programme.desc: A Chicago cop looking to avenge the death of his partner heads to New Orleans and kidnaps the killer's mistress by handcuffing himself to her.

programme.title: Life Without Dick
programme.desc: After shooting her boyfriend, she meets the hitman who had been planning to kill him. As the two dispose of his body, romantic sparks begin to fly.

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: When her plane crashes into a Chicago bridge, ace reporter Gale Gayley is saved by a mysterious and unlikely hero in this heart-warming comedy.

programme.title: Wind
programme.desc: The open seas are ripe for adventure and romance as a man does his best to win the America’s Cup for the U.S. in a string of yacht races.

programme.title: Side Out
programme.desc: In this high-spirited tribute to the California lifestyle, it’s a summer of fun when Monroe and Zack hit Malibu Beach for a volleyball tournament.

programme.title: Into Thin Air: Death on Everest
programme.desc: The compelling and dramatic true story of two teams of hikers as they made their dangerous and fatal ascent on Mt. Everest in early 1996.

programme.title: I Dreamed of Africa
programme.desc: A bored Italian socialite abandons her jet-set lifestyle for the rigors and rewards of rural Kenya in this true story based on a best-selling memoir.

programme.title: The China Syndrome
programme.desc: A news reporter (Jane Fonda) and her cameraman (Michael Douglas) are unintentional witnesses to a SCRAM incident, an emergency core shutdown procedure at a nuclear power plant in California. The crew prevents a catastrophe, but the plant supervisor (Jack Lemmon) begins to suspect the plant is in violation of safety standards, and tries desperately to bring it to the attention of the public, fearing that another SCRAM incident will produce an atomic disaster.

programme.title: Striking Distance
programme.desc: Bruce Willis and Sarah Jessica Parker star in this crime thriller about a demoted homicide cop who works with his partner to find his father’s killer.

programme.title: The Ambushers
programme.desc: When an experimental flying saucer is brought down in Mexico, secret agent Matt Helm is sent to find it and keep it from falling into enemy hands.

programme.title: Dead Reckoning
programme.desc: A war hero steps off a train and into a world of gambling, blackmail and murder while searching for a fellow vet who inexplicably disappeared himself.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The long-standing bond between two small-time smugglers sailing around the Caribbean is threatened when a gorgeous siren seeks passage on their boat.

programme.title: The Goddess
programme.desc: As a child, she was Emily Ann, a poor girl in the South with no friends and an ineffective mother. But as an adult, she's Rita Shawn (Kim Stanley), an actress loved the world over. Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: When a brash reporter starts trailing a runaway heiress on her bus trip from Florida to New York for a big scoop, can love be far behind?

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: A World War II classic about the violence, quarrels, and romantic intrigue affecting a group of soldiers at Pearl Harbor before the tragic attack.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: When the idealistic young Jefferson Smith (James Stewart) winds up appointed to the United States Senate, he gains the mentorship of Senator Joseph Paine (Claude Rains). However, Paine isn't as noble as his reputation would indicate, and he becomes involved in a scheme to discredit Smith, who wants to build a boys' campsite where a more lucrative project could go. Determined to stand up against Paine and his corrupt peers, Smith takes his case to the Senate floor.

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acuña (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers who’ve been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: Let Us Live
programme.desc: When a confused eyewitness identifies New York City cabbie Brick Tennant (Henry Fonda) as a killer, he is sentenced to death for a murder that he wasn't involved in. Though no one is willing to listen to the innocent prisoner's pleas for freedom, Brick's faithful fiancée, Mary (Maureen O'Sullivan), knows that her lover is innocent -- because she was with him when the crime was committed. As the scheduled execution draws ever nearer, Mary begins to investigate the murder herself.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: In a Connecticut suburb, Ned notices there are pools throughout the neighborhood and decides to "swim" home via the pools of his wealthy friends.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: This Academy Award winner for Best Picture tells the story of an idealistic Southern politician brought down by his own ambition and lust for power.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: What a Woman!
programme.desc: An author (Willard Parker) and a literary agent (Rosalind Russell) become involved after selling film rights to his racy book.

programme.title: Decameron Nights
programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Man
programme.desc: Clumsy sanitation worker Red Jones (Red Skelton) is fired from his street-cleaning job shortly after his girlfriend, Ann Elliot (Janet Blair), refuses his marriage proposal until he betters himself. While training to become a door-to-door salesman, he accidentally stumbles into a murder investigation when the corrupt sanitation commissioner (Nicholas Joy) who had fired him is killed. When the murder weapon is found to be one of the brushes Red sells, he must fight to prove his innocence.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: During WW II, Lt. Rip Crandall and his inexperienced and motley crew get assigned to deliver an Australian observer to a Japanese-held island.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A young model finds her dreams of fame coming true when she rents billboards in New York to advertise herself, attracting fans and two rival suitors.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.

programme.title: California Conquest
programme.desc: A Spanish swashbuckler (Cornel Wilde) and a gunsmith's daughter (Teresa Wright) oppose a Russian plot to annex California.

programme.title: Reprisal!
programme.desc: Frank Madden (Guy Madison), who is part Native American but passes as white, purchases a ranch in the small town of Kendall, Okla. When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: The Walking Hills
programme.desc: During a poker game in a Mexican bar, a group of men discover the location of a lost wagon train -- and its cargo of gold. To prevent one man from cheating the rest, it's decided that they will find it together. Among them are horse breeder Jim Carey (Randolph Scott) and rodeo rider Shep Wilson (William Bishop) ; like their cohorts in the treasure hunt, they share a tangled history -- Chris Jackson (Ella Raines), Shep's current sweetheart, is Jim's old flame. Greed and suspicion soon break out.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: The Doolins of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Old West outlaw Bill Doolin (Randolph Scott) marries a deacon's wife, but his gang will not leave him alone.

programme.title: The Outlaws Is Coming
programme.desc: Moe, Larry and Curly Joe (Adam West) bring their head-knocking, eye-gouging antics to the Wild West. When reporter Kenneth Cabot (Nancy Kovack) heads to Wyoming to stop the slaughter of buffaloes, he brings the stooges with him. There, they trade barbs with Billy the Kid, Jesse James and Wild Bill Hickock, while Cabot gets elected town sheriff. But they'll need some help from Annie Oakley (Mort Mills) when it comes to foiling the criminal plans of a land-hungry frontier villain.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: J.W. Coop
programme.desc: After spending a decade behind bars for writing bad checks and punching a cop, former rodeo star J.W. Coop (Cliff Robertson) re-enters a world drastically different from how he left it; the only constant seems to be his mother (Geraldine Page). Gradually coming to terms with societal changes and cultural norms, Coop is determined to climb back to the top spot on the rodeo circuit. Along the way, he hooks up with Bean (Cristina Ferrare), a liberated woman who helps him catch up to modern life.

programme.title: Count Three and Pray
programme.desc: After fighting for the Union during the Civil War, Luke Fargo (Van Heflin) is greeted with resentment when he returns home to his small southern town. Luke has a reputation as a rogue, but he's reinvented himself as a man of God and plans to fix up the town's damaged church. Recalling their romantic past, Georgina Decrais (Allison Hayes) tries to reclaim Luke. But, to the dismay of some suspicious townspeople, he concentrates on mentoring an unsophisticated young woman, Lissy (Joanne Woodward).

programme.title: Scalplock
programme.desc: A frontier gambler (Dale Robertson) wins a railroad in a card game and has to keep it going as people try to take it away from him.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: Love's Secret Ingredient
programme.desc: The owner of a struggling market teams up with a celebrity chef to revive each other’s reputations.

programme.title: Food for the Heart
programme.desc: After taking on too much with her meal delivery service, Lia accepts her neighbor Eli’s help.

programme.title: Falling for the Manny
programme.desc: Alice is up for partner at her firm and hires her sister’s manny, Jacob, to help with her daughter.

programme.title: Meet You in Scotland
programme.desc: A Scottish poet mistakes a writer’s identity, forcing her to choose between new love or the truth.

programme.title: The Perfect Man(icure)
programme.desc: Katya partners with consultant Ryan to sell her manicure device at the upcoming Beauty Expo.

programme.title: Falling For the Competition
programme.desc: A local mom’s and dad’s group clash for the prestigious Modern Parenting Group of the Year award.

programme.title: The Wedding Chapel
programme.desc: Uninspired and newly single, painter Sara is down on her luck and wants nothing more than to get away.

programme.title: Til Death Do Us Part
programme.desc: A new bride with a heart condition becomes fearfully suspicious that her husband is a far different person than he claimed to be before they married.

programme.title: Cradle of Lies
programme.desc: Five years ago Melissa went into labor while in a coma. She has just awoken with no information about her baby girl, and so her frantic search begins.

programme.title: Crash Site: A Family In Danger
programme.desc: A Jeep crash sends a vacationing couple on a creepy trip back to safety.

programme.title: Dancing Trees
programme.desc: Martha, an autistic young woman with a talent for numbers, attempts to solve the murder of her mother with the help of her cousin.

programme.title: Romantic Friction
programme.desc: Sparks fly between a book cover artist posing as the author of a hit romance novel and the snooty writer who actually penned it under a pseudonym.

programme.title: New Dogs, Old Tricks
programme.desc: Tiny receives notice that his bar will close unless he pays $17,000 and his customers rally around him with a plan to save it; meanwhile Jay's hazing practices start to raise red flags.

programme.title: New Dogs, Old Tricks
programme.desc: Tiny receives notice that his bar will close unless he pays $17,000 and his customers rally around him with a plan to save it; meanwhile Jay's hazing practices start to raise red flags.

programme.title: Eat, Love, London
programme.desc: Stella takes a job at a new London restaurant and ends up falling for the chef.

programme.title: Planning for Joy

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny impulsively buys a '69 Caddy and falls madly in love with her. Will he sell it for a big profit, or add her to his collection?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is commissioned to restore a family heirloom '67 Ford Mustang.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny decides to host a huge car show at his club Vamp'd to drum up business, and get all the local gearheads together to show off their newest toys.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny takes on a Route 66-inspired Chevy for the famed highway's biggest fan, and later teams up with his good buddy, American Restoration's Rick Dale.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A high wire performer wants Danny to build a bike to commemorate his career and the records he has broken.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Pawn Stars' "Old Man" Mr. Harrison stops by Count's Kustoms with a job that is as unique and old fashioned as he is.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: An eccentric couple wants to turn a 20 year-old ambulance into a ghost-hunting vehicle, which awakens a rogue spirit in the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A customer is brought to tears when the shop presents him with a chopper dedicated to his lost mother.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: After two blown sales, Danny finally gets to customize a 1960 Chevy Delivery the way he wants to.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny tries to score an ex-police motorcycle without getting busted, while a watermain break threatens to put the shop permanently under water.

programme.desc: Danny discovers the rarest Cadillac collection he's ever seen. Later, Horny Mike has 30 days to move his big ugly bus.

programme.desc: Danny and Kevin visit mad mechanic Gordon to see his latest insane creation. Meanwhile, Danny shakes the rust off a '34 Ford.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard fights the weather while hauling heavy, slick trees on the steepest setting of the season; Danny Pihl and his veteran crew precisely drop 250-foot, old-growth cedars next to a group of cabins.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard races to clear a hillside in time to fill four logging trucks; Jay R Harkness fights to control the untethered Tigercat on a steep, snow-covered mountainside; Bucking Billy and his son Hogan battle a forest of hang-ups and widow-makers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Four companies of loggers risk their lives to chop down timber while dealing with mechanical failures, brutal weather and rugged terrain in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: J.M. Browning strives to meet a big deadline; Stump Branch Logging tempts fate by jury-rigging old equipment; Gustafson races the weather to build an access road; Pihl Logging hauls in the forest's cash crop.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers race to stay one step ahead of a storm approaching the Oregon coast; Jesse pushes his crew to meet their deadline; muddy roads trap Stump Branch trucks; Robby battles for control; lumber market slump.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Danny Pihl relies on the experience of veteran cutters Dwayne and Chuck to take down massive old-growth trees; Craig Rygaard discovers son Jason made a catastrophic and costly miscalculation; Frank Harkness races to transport $100,000 worth of logs.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: As the logging season winds down, the pressure to produce, heats up. In Alaska, a family emergency takes Mark from the yarder seat and with no time for a shut down.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The news of upcoming layoffs worries the men; Gustafson Logging tries to get back on track; Browning races to meet a big deadline; Pihl Logging is under pressure to finish its Pig Farm job.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Two of Oregon's logging giants, J.M. Browning and Gustafson Logging, fight to survive; Jay Browning must make tough decisions; smaller outfits find winning strategies.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The gap widens between winners and losers at the halfway point of the season; Stump Branch tests a dangerous logging strategy; the Pihl men play while the bosses are away; a mistake by the Gustafson crew may end a man's career.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers barely survive in a plummeting market; the Gustafson bosses have a close call; an old hook-tender returns to the Browning team, halting Jesse's rise to management; Pihl loses a crucial member of the team.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some loggers have more reasons to be grateful than do others as Thanksgiving arrives; the Pihl crew loses men to illness; the Gustafson crew's younger members blow off steam; the season's first snowfall bodes a warning for the Stump Branch crew.

programme.desc: The Gustafson crew faces a nearly impossible deadline; half the Pihl crew skips work; Stump Branch mistakes and inexperience put profits and lives at risk; Jay Browning makes a troubling discovery about his next job.
